Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Ideas by Nature has been briefed on bringing a web refresh scoped into the engagement. We will have updates next week after our meetings with them. Please feel free to DM us with specific issues or requests.

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Hey all, one more post about the scalability solution

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: https://komodoplatform.com/komodo-platform-new-scalability-solution/

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: The first one is meant to be a technical explanation, this one is meant to be more B2B and explaining the benefits of the tech (rather than the tech itself)

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Also, for anyone that is interested in taking a look at the 3 remaining 'pillars of blockchain' posts, here is a link to the folder. Feel free to poke around:

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1lnR21teBZxCyU50GQ2UNjf5L20wTZh4a?usp=sharing

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: And, just for good measure, here's a preview of a couple of other educational posts that will help support some of the more foundational marketing content:

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1V1IebeZp5lqhOj9DFrf2W0aTr_GDTfBsEqn7JlVwSrA/edit?usp=sharing

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dyQ_V5BaJ-kyQHH_jG7jyLWXVuuJnBaHC5c6KHCEi84/edit?usp=sharing

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: We'll be pushing out more stuff like this in the coming months. THere are a few ideas why. First, some of this knowledge is necessary to understand Komodo's tech so we want to give ppl the chance to learn about it but we don't want to constantly have to explain it. So we can just link back to posts like these again and again. Second, it will serve some SEO purposes and draw in some organic traffic from Google. Third, we hope to build a large body of educational content about blockchain-related topics so that we can establish Komodo as an authority in the space (we are but ppl may not know that). Maybe in the future we'll be able to pull it altogether for an e-book or something along those lines

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: As always, all comments/feedback/suggestions are welcomed!

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
Circulating Supply = 104,254,857 = 100%

SuperNET = 5,638,992 = 5.41%
Development = 10,000,000 = 9.59%
Voters = 42,785,082 = 41.04%
Total Off CEX = 58,424,074 = 56.04%
        
Binance = 142,435 = 0.14%
Bittrex = 218,822 = 0.21%
UpBit = 127,698 = 0.12%
**These exchange balances are only of trading volume which could be double counted, and of sell side order books, of which only a small percentage is available for viewing.**        
Found On CEX    488,955    0.47%

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Just threw that together on a spread sheet from some looking around

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I haven't benchmarked it against other coins just yet. I also haven't been able to account for Z address balances. or use a richlist since we don't have one right now.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: And I'd like to get a better idea of the true exchange balances but haven't really found any of their wallets

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Anyway, this was just my take on trying to figure out how we can approach a liquidity problem for our DEXs. it seems enough of the coins are off exchanges for there to NOT be a liquidity problem (assuming everyone wanted to trade and not just Hodl) but I think it would also be important to create a rich list to figure out how much of KMD is being held by a few hodlers.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: These numbers are also not MECE, as Development funds could have been used for Voting? and I haven't accounted for the depletion of Development funds since ICO.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: But anyway, it would be helpful to get balances of whales and core dev who have been around a long time and likely accumulated a lot, we don't need to announce balances etc as that is private stuff but I'm predicting that low single digit percentages of coin supply could be held by certain members. Not saying this is bad, but maybe they would be interested in being liquidity providers, we just need a better way to find them without outing anyone's ID or tying them to wallet addresses

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Why does Komodo need to be a legal entity? It's an open source project and not having an entity to go after is one of its strengths

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
Here's my take

- Open source development should be kept separate from the 'for profit' side or 'legal side'
 - Some legal entities are necessary to make business deals and partnerships, and to generate a revenue model for the long term foture.

What is the best approach to do this is a huge question that our team is researching. Not much more can be said at this point.

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: I agree with Audo. Just because some form of a legal entity exists doesn't mean that it has to be directly associated with or even called "komodo", but having a legal entity is gonna be essential whether we like it or not

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: VC funds and other large investors won't do touch a decentralized, open-source platform

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: And we don't necessarily need funds right this second-- things are humming along just fine -- but there are many competitors out there flush with cash who will catch up with our tech if we aren't careful

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: So raising funds will prob become very important at some point in the future

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: So a foundation structure is needed first which doesn't engage in business directly and a llc to engage in business.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: That's the proper way of doing it. However, how are you going to create a foundation for an already established project that didn't run KYC during the ICO?
